name: deafness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being unable to hear, either completely or partly: She was finally diagnosed with profound deafness at 19 months. Such tumours occur in one of the nerves in the brain and can lead to deafness in one ear.
an unwillingness to listen, or a lack of understanding about something: There has been a deliberate deafness to women's complaints of harassment. What struck me about the list was its deafness to fashion. See
deaf
More examplesFewer examplesShe suffers from a rare condition that can cause deafness in a few months.The authors report a case of sudden permanent deafness following anaesthesia for dental surgery.He has retired and is frustrated by his increasing deafness.There were jeers about his deafness to the electorate.
